alert.note: Alert for Maricopa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 23 at 4:33PM MST until September 23 at 8:45PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... * Until 845 PM MST. * At 433 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Phoenix, Scottsdale, New River, Cave Creek, Carefree, Camp Creek, Desert Mountain and Seven Springs. This includes the following streams and drainages... Copper Camp Creek, Indian Spring Wash, Verde River, Cottonwood Creek, Galloway Wash, Blue Wash, Davenport Wash, Cave Creek, Lime Creek, Sheep Creek, South Fork Sheep Creek, Deadman Creek, North Canyon Creek, Camp Creek, Sycamore Creek, Rodger Creek, New River, Seven Springs Wash, Deadman Wash, Grapevine Wash, Apache Wash and Skunk Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
